page.title: 08Farming Typical of Area.
page.content: Hengoed Fawr is similar t0 all the other farms in our block .Being near a town it grows some vegetables for the local market, but concentrates mostly on dairy cattle. On the farm we find 25 acres of barley, 12 acres of maize (winter animal feed), 2 acres of potatoes, 2 acres of swedes and 163 acres of grass. There is a herd of 90 dairy cattle, which is milked twice daily. There are also 90 calves on the farm, which are kept until they become milking cattle. The older dairy cattle are then sold, to be replaced by younger ones which have been bred on the farm. During the winter 200 sheep are kept. These are sold in the spring.
